intro: Crotalaria inopinata, commonly known as the purple false flax, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with a distinctive purple throat. The plant has palmately compound leaves and produces elongated pods that contain several seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Crotalaria inopinata is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen, which makes it a valuable plant in certain ecological contexts.
